comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_S._West William Stanley West (August 23, 1849 – December 22, 1914) was a United States Senator from the state of Georgia. He was a Democrat.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: A few days after the 1914-2-26 date written on this negative, West was appointed to the Senate.  In November 1914 he returned to being a "planter and lumberman."  In December 1914, he died.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: In March 1914 the Governor of Georgia appointed West U. S. Senator, to fill out the unexpired term of Senator Augustus O. Bacon, who had died. West did not run for election to the office in November, 1914, and retired in that month after the election of a successor.) His death on December 22 was unexpected, as he had been in good health. New York Times death notice, December 23, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9804E...

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks to all of you for the information and the links. We'll fill in the name in the caption next time we update the record.
